tweets.text:
Trees are vital in protecting our rivers.  

That‚Äôs why we‚Äôre putting ¬£1.4 million towards funding 15 community projects to plant more trees near rivers and streams.  

Read: https://t.co/Gf0f3pgLNY  
 
#PlantMoreTrees #NationalTreeWeek #TogetherForOurPlanet https://t.co/9ILpU5ivbX
@True_Belle @DefraGovUK @EnvAgencySW @EnvAgency I‚Äôm with @True_Belle on this 100%. Scrap HS2, save the trees and the environment while also saving a huge amount of money.
@DefraGovUK @EnvAgencySW @EnvAgency Cancel the vanity project #HS2 and save the mature trees from being grubbed up. Value what we have already .

Trees deserve to be enjoyed by everyone üå≤üå≥ 
 
That‚Äôs why we‚Äôre giving ¬£3.9 million to #PlantMoreTrees outside of woodlands, in our cities, towns and rivers. 

Watch our video to find out more üëá 

‚û°Ô∏è https://t.co/PuTzpXtAj9  

@EnvAgency #NationalTreeWeek #TogetherForOurPlanet https://t.co/wNYqkfX3PK

A mile of the River Lugg has been bulldozed to destruction.
Bankside trees grubbed out & burnt.
Riverbed scraped out.
Meanders reprofiled.
Disaster for downstream wildlife.
This was an SSSI.
No consent was sought. 
@EnvAgency must surely prosecute this.
RT
https://t.co/cSBhrR2nDW

tweets.text:
Shocked and appalled at this damage to a protected wildlife site. The River Lugg is home to many threatened invertebrates. We hope that @NaturalEngland and @EnvAgency take appropriate action to ensure the site is restored, and protected for the future
https://t.co/ZLI76RRJAt

@CKirbyLambert @NaturalEngland @EnvAgency This work was carried out to @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland standard at the cost of several million pounds?. May have cost the farmer ¬£50 to 100k or even less, fine is likely to be + cost's ,less than 1/2 ¬£Mill. Its all the more cynical but also shows the law and Gov to be useless.

We‚Äôve used our powers of entry at the River Lugg #Herefordshire incident

14 specialist officers from @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm @WMerciaPolice @HfdsCouncil now on site gathering information & evidence. https://t.co/LLCOFQHCox

A truly egregious act of eco vandalism on the River Lugg ü§¨üòû. The river is a SSSI making this completely illegal. I surveyed it  the past and the river shingles were packed with rare invertebrates. @NaturalEngland @EnvAgency need to show such acts won't go unpunished. https://t.co/02bxbAnbMK
Let's hope the @EnvAgency @DefraGovUK do the right thing and throw the book at him... https://t.co/XzMY0XtcGW
